item.title: Ubuntu Server 8.04 Post Install Tip #1: Auto Updating
item.description: On a headless server that you have at home or for testing I like to make sure that all security updates and trivial updates are done automatically. A good sys admin will shy away from this practice for a good reason, updates can mess things up. In a production environment or where the server setup is very complex I can understand the need to manually run updates. For me, well Iâ€™m lazy when it comes to my home machines and generally donâ€™t have too complex of setups. Also, in my experience, Iâ€™ve hardly ever seen an apt security or trivial update cause any harm (desktop linux I have seen issues though). That being said, I like to force security and trivial updates to happen daily.
